channel.title: Escape - Prysm
channel.description:
I personally think that this is my best song so far, but it only got 26 plays and then died. help. my most recent one only got 7 as well
Here’s my best one https://soundcloud.com/prysmedm/escape
Hope you guys can help, thanks.

item.title: Escape - Prysm
item.dc:creator: TXA
item.description:
If you’d like to discover more discord servers, or if you don’t have discord in the first place, I can help with that. Shoot me a pm if u have any questions. Glad to help.

item.title: Escape - Prysm
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
Post them on discord servers that allow promotion, consider sending them to promo accs on SC, and try to generally increase your follower base if you really care about publicity. I wouldn’t stress about it though. Focus on producing high quality music and you’ll naturally grow in popularity.

Read full topic

item.title: Escape - Prysm

item.description:
I mean I don’t know how else to promote my music without paying money, and I’ve made 13 songs in less than six months so I’m definitely consistent. Idk what else to do.

item.title: Escape - Prysm
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
He seemed quite concerned about his lack of plays on his songs, so I’m explaining that you should expect the number of plays you get to be roughly in the ballpark of the amount of followers you have (atleast when you’re a small producer).

Read full topic

item.title: Escape - Prysm
item.dc:creator: therealejoc
item.description:
That wasn’t really a helpful or relevant feedback tbh. No offense I just think that it was kind of a minor point. Just listen to the song and give some feedback and add this on to that if you feel it must be said.

Edit: I’m not trying to come off as stuck up, I’m just trying to help the community and I don’t think you intended this badly. Sorry if I came off wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Escape - Prysm
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
You have 44 followers so I’m not exactly sure what you expect in terms of plays.

EDIT: No offense of course. Everyone starts small, but you shouldn’t expect too much in the way of plays unless you promote your music a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: Escape - Prysm
item.dc:creator: therealejoc
item.description:
First off. It isn’t all about the plays, don’t worry as much about those. I didn’t like the buildup much, I personally prefer softer buildups and this one sounded harsh. That opinion could be different to others though. The drop was nice but it needed more chord variety a bit. The same two or three play throughout the song and it sounds nice but maybe don’t overuse it. The volume is up a lot on the builds and it takes away from the drums. Try using automations to create tension and build it up . The melodies in the drop was nice and I liked the transition with the start and stop to the second build. Overall I would say work on intentional instrument choices and mix the song a bit more, maybe throw in some automations to spice things up. Good song overall. Thanks for sharing

Read full topic

item.title: Escape - Prysm
item.dc:creator: Prysm
item.description:
Yeah, I know

Read full topic

item.title: Escape - Prysm
item.dc:creator: BobTheGUYYYYY
item.description:
I liked it! My opinion on the song is that it was a little too much; it was very in-your-face. If that’s how you want it, that’s fine. My only other thing was i feel like the name was inappropriate. This song gave me more of a “freedom” vibe. Otherwise nice job. The layering that you used made it very good.

Read full topic
